creditline: Gift of Stephen Addiss and Audrey Yoshiko Seo
description: 14 lines of rather small, looping calligraphy; two large red seals at left edge, below center
marks: [壬戌之秋︐七月既望︐蘇子與客泛舟遊於赤壁之下︒淸風徐来︐水波不興︐舉酒屬客︐誦明月之詩︐歌窈窕之章
text: Okon was just ten years old when she wrote the first of Su Shi's (1037-1101) two Odes to the Red Cliff. She proves her prowess in a long text with rhythmical flowing cursive script. Okon was praised by many literati of her day and even performed in front of the Emperor at age ten her rewaredd her with a jade cup.
title: Su Shi's First Ode to the Red Cliff
